title.narrative: Life-saving interventions to reduce preventable mortality and morbidity among U5 children and pregnant and lactating women

description.narrative: The objective of the UNICEF project is to reduce preventable and avoidable mortality and morbidity in drought-affected districts of DPR Korea through life-saving interventions among children under five and pregnant and lactating women. In particular, UNICEF will procure and deliver 3,500 cartons of oral rehydration solution (ORS) to treat some 60,000 diarrheal cases in community and county health clinics; and provide 1,600 household doctor kits with sufficient supplies to manage pneumonia and diarrhoea at the household level. Some 265,000 people will benefit from this project over a six-month period.
